717915f-b.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park
717915f-b.text:
(1)
Bryant Park: A view of the Open--Air Library of the Extension
DDivision of the New York Public Library located in the S.E. corner.
This scene shows several readers and a librarian at the periodical
rack at the foot of the Goethe bust.
Pall 1936.
Cift of deo. D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The librarian's table; a centre of this infornal and highly
popular unit.
Fall 1936.
Gift of Geo. D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717914f-a.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park - Street Scenes
717914f-a.text:
Street Scenes: Bryant ark provides the setting for this
lOvely scene.
Norris Engel  1941
CREDIT LINE IMPERDTIU

717923f-c.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park (Northwestern quarter).
717923f-c.text:
(1)
Bryant Park, northwestern quarter, seen from the rear of the
New York Public Library, showing the Fark under reconstruction.
April 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, a later stage of the reconstruction carried out under
Park Commissioner Robert Moses.
August 8, 1934.
P. L. Spenr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, another view.
August 11, 1934.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717917f-a.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park - East Center
717917f-a.text:
(1)
Demolition of the Federal Hall replica, Bryant Park, east-center,
the New York Public Libary in the background, the year after
the George Washington Bicentennial Celebration.
The skyscrapers seen on the roof of the Libnary are, from left
to right: the Chrysler Building, the Lincoln Building, the
Lefcourt Colonial Builoing on Madison Avenue ano the much
smaller Farmers Loan \& Trust Builoing on Fifth Avenue, and
finally the New York Trust Company Building.
April 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO RA.PRODUCTIONS.
717917f-a.folder: Bryant Park & East Center, Manhattan, NY

717907f-a.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park
717907f-a.text:
Bryant Park: The fountain in the Mestern portion as over-
shadowed by the huge 500 Fifth Avenue Building. Adjacent to same
is the secondary Salmon Tower with the still lower (formmer) Aeolian
Hall. To the right and forming the Fifth Avenue frontage is the
New York Public Library.
Augst 5, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
